page.title: 13Dean Flower Show
page.content: The main weekend of the Dean year is the first in August when the Flower Show is held in the Eileen Wade School and a marquee in the grounds. The competition runs to about 70 classes open to the residents of Dean and Shelton. The cost per entry is small, the prizes small but the prestige of winning is large! Everyone is encouraged to participate with the classes covering all types of vegetables, flower arranging, photography and several classes for the children.There is a cup for the overall winner and runner up and also 1 to the novice with most points- someone who has lived in the area for less than 5 years. There is also a prize for the prettiest front garden as seen from the road. There are stalls, teas, puppet shows and races. an art exhibition of locals is held.
